content.description: This is an obvious route on the right side of Big Blue Boulder, the slab side.  Either grab some small pebbles to start, or reach a high hand to grab the first edge. A high foot will get you on the route. Then find the HUGE swoosh, work your way up, grab another pebble, and top out.
content.protection: There are two landings, a crash pad for each will be required if you fall near the top.
content.location: This is on Big Blue Boulder.

content.description: This route is on the left side of the slab face of Big Blue Boulder. Start is in an obvious crack line, and pull to the next seam to get on the ledge. Take a step left, and think about your life choices, as now if you fall, you better fall back to the right. Then go straight up, grabbing several half pad edges with similar edges to stand on. The topout is on the right jug.
content.protection: A couple of crash pads and perhaps a pad on the middle platform below where you must step left.
content.location: It is on the left side of Big Blue Boulder.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
